citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
On November 15, 2024, the veterinary staff discovered 4 ferret kits had been given a larger than intended dose of post-op
Meloxicam. The IACUC approved protocol for post-op Meloxicam for this study is 0.1-0.2 mg/kg PO/SQ q24 hours. The
Meloxicam dose was drawn from the 1.5 mg/ml concentration bottle instead of the 0.1 mg/ml concentration bottle. This
resulted in a range of 1.4 – 1.6 mg/kg dose for the 4 kits based on their weight, which resulted in a 7-8 times overdose of
post-op Meloxicam. Veterinarians and staff took immediate action and provided supportive care, and the kits did not
experience any side effects from the overdose. The lab has revised their standing operating practices to include
verification of doses and concentration of anesthetics and analgesics prior to administration. Additionally, the lab will only
store diluted Meloxicam (0.1 mg/ml) in the vivarium for post-op analgesia. Not following the IACUC approved protocol can
result in the wellbeing and health of the animals being adversely affected. The IACUC must review and approve, require
modifications in, or withhold approval of proposed significant changes regarding the care and use of animals in ongoing
activities. CORRECTED PRIOR TO THIS INSPECTION CONCLUDED ON 04/23/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with attending veterinarian.
